questions.answer_en:
# Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA)

## Definition
An LMIA is a document that Canadian employers must obtain proving:
- No suitable Canadian citizen or permanent resident available
- Hiring a foreign worker will not negatively impact the Canadian labour market

## Application Process

### Employer Steps
1. **Post job advertisements**
   - Minimum 4 weeks
   - Use at least 3 recruitment channels
   - Must include Job Bank

2. **Submit LMIA application**
   - Pay fee: $1,000 CAD
   - Provide recruitment proof
   - Justify hiring foreign worker

3. **Wait for approval**
   - Processing time: 8-29 business days
   - Depends on position category

### Worker Steps
After positive LMIA:
1. Employer provides LMIA copy
2. Worker applies for work permit
3. Submit LMIA number with application

## Exemptions

No LMIA required for:
- International Mobility Program (IMP)
- Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)
- CUSMA/NAFTA work permits
- Spousal open work permits
- Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP)

## Fees
- Employer LMIA application: $1,000 CAD
- Employer compliance fee: $275 CAD
- Worker permit application: $155 CAD

questions.answer_en:
# Open Work Permit

## Definition
An open work permit allows you to:
- Work for **any** Canadian employer
- No employer-specific restrictions
- No LMIA required
- Change jobs without reapplying

## Who Can Apply?

### 1. Spouses/Common-law Partners
- Spouse of work permit holder
- Spouse of student (in graduate program)
- Spouse of provincial nominee applicant

### 2. Graduates
- Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP)
- Graduated from Designated Learning Institution (DLI)

### 3. Refugees/Humanitarian
- Refugee claimants
- Protected persons
- Humanitarian & compassionate applicants

### 4. Bridging Work Permit
- PR application submitted
- Current work permit expiring soon

### 5. Pilot Program Participants
- Caregiver pilot programs
- Certain agricultural worker programs

## Comparison: Open vs. Employer-Specific

| Feature | Open Permit | Employer-Specific |
|---------|-------------|-------------------|
| Employer choice | Any employer | Specific employer only |
| Job changes | No reapplication | New permit required |
| LMIA | Not needed | Usually required |
| Flexibility | High | Low |
| Cost | $255 CAD | $155 CAD |

## Application Fees
- Open work permit holder fee: $100 CAD
- Work permit fee: $155 CAD
- **Total**: $255 CAD

# Work Rights for Study Permit Holders

## Yes, You Can Work!

Full-time students can:

### During Academic Terms (On/Off-campus)
- Work up to **20 hours per week**
- No separate work permit needed
- Must have valid study permit

### During Breaks
- Work **full-time** (unlimited hours)
- Includes winter, summer, spring breaks

### After Graduation
- Apply for **Post-Graduation Work Permit** (PGWP)
- Up to 3-year work permit
- Duration depends on study program length

## Eligibility Requirements

Must meet:
1. âœ… Full-time student status
2. âœ… Attending Designated Learning Institution (DLI)
3. âœ… Enrolled in degree/diploma/certificate program
4. âœ… Study permit states work allowed

## Important Notes

âš ï¸ **Cannot work if**:
- Language programs (ESL/FSL)
- General interest courses
- Preparatory programs
- Study permit states "not authorized to work"

## Internships & Co-op Programs

If program includes internship:
- May need **Co-op work permit**
- Part of study program
- Apply together with study permit

# Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) Scoring

## Total: 1200 points

### A. Core Factors (max 600)

#### 1. Age (max 110)
- **Optimal**: 20-29 years (110 points)
- 18-19: 99-105 points
- 30-39: Gradually decreases
- 40+: Continues decreasing
- 45+: 0 points

#### 2. Education (max 150)
- PhD: 150 points
- Master's: 135 points
- Two degrees: 128 points
- Bachelor's: 120 points
- Diploma (3-year): 120 points
- Diploma (2-year): 98 points
- Diploma (1-year): 90 points
- High school: 30 points

#### 3. Language (max 160)
**First language**:
- CLB 10+: Up to 34 per ability
- CLB 9: Up to 32 per ability
- CLB 8: Up to 23 per ability
- CLB 7: Up to 17 per ability

**Second language** (bonus):
- CLB 5-7: Up to 24 points

#### 4. Canadian Work Experience (max 80)
- 5+ years: 80 points
- 4 years: 70 points
- 3 years: 55 points
- 2 years: 40 points
- 1 year: 40 points

### B. Spouse Factors (max 40)

With accompanying spouse:
- Spouse education: Max 10
- Spouse language: Max 20
- Spouse Canadian work: Max 10

### C. Skill Transferability (max 100)

Combination bonuses:
- Education + Language
- Education + Canadian work
- Foreign work + Language
- Trade certificate + Language

### D. Additional Points (max 600)

- **Provincial nomination**: +600 âœ¨
- Valid job offer: +50-200
- Canadian education: +15-30
- Sibling in Canada: +15
- French proficiency: +25-50

2. ğŸ“š Improve language scores (CLB 9+)

4. ğŸ’¼ Gain Canadian work experience
